subtitles.text: Upcami
Here we go...it's up-cam! This time with Saya Eguchi from Beyonce and Subway,
Beyonce, and Minami Okamura of Ameagari Kawakai.
This is a program that goes behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the upfront group.
We will show you the process of recording and rehearsal.
Let's start with a behind-the-scenes look at the two MCs. I, Eguchi, met all the members for the first time in a while the other day,

It had been quite a while since we had all worked together, so we didn't have much contact with each other, so when we met in person, we didn't exchange much more than a "good morning" or "good afternoon".
So when we met in person, we kind of said good morning.
I didn't really get a sense of the distance between us, but when we talked, we were able to have a good time as usual.
But when it had been a while and there was a gap between us, my shyness was triggered.
But I've always been a little bit shy to begin with.
That's right, we get along well when we see each other every day.
But if you see each other every day, you get to know each other well.
No, no, no, it's only for 10 days or so, right?
Yes, I was a little surprised myself.
I didn't realize it at all.
There was a time when I didn't realize it.
I, Okamura, fell down for the first time in 5 or 6 years.
Yes, I fell down and scraped my knee.
It was the first time since I became Beyonce, so it's been five or six years.
The last time I fell down, my mother would disinfect me as soon as she got home.
It was small.
But I had a big enough scar that a normal bandage wouldn't work anymore.
You lived boldly, didn't you?
Yes, so I had to go out and buy a bandage, disinfect it, and patch it up by myself.
It was probably the first time in my life.
It hurt a little bit, but all I could do was laugh.
I was like, "Why did I fall down when I grew up?
It was really funny.
If I was in the middle of a concert tour, there was a possibility that it might have affected my performance.
But now I'm taking a break.
I still think the timing was good.
I feel like I've had a good life experience.
I have to be careful in my life.
I'll be careful.

I have just finished shooting the music video for my solo song, "I gotta go! which will be included in the new single to be released on June 14.
We really shot it in the morning at the beach,
Recently, Anju's music video shoots outside have been either rain or strong winds, but today it was sunny and I was very happy,
I was very happy that it was sunny today.
But the strong wind was still there.
I don't know why I have such a good luck with wind,
But we had a great time shooting this morning, and there are many highlights,
I hope you will enjoy watching it.
Bye bye!
The sea and the scenery are so beautiful, and Takeuchi-san's bright smile is so wonderful,
There were a lot of scenes with free movement, which is what we usually do when we shoot music videos,
In our usual music video shooting, there are dance scenes and lip scenes with hands on the camera,
I thought it would be very difficult because I have never shot a scene where we move freely in a room.
I, Okamura, heard this song for the first time at Akari Takeuchi's graduation performance at Yokohama Arena the other day,
It was the first time I heard Ms. Takeuchi in her red and blue dress singing this song, and it is a really wonderful song, as well as the lyrics and melody that only Takeuchi-san can sing.
I have always felt that Takeuchi-san's straight, high-pitched voice is also very attractive,
I have always felt that Takeuchi's straight, high-pitched voice is also very appealing, so I really felt the charm of this song, and it has become my favorite song.

I think this song by Beyonce, "Can't Even Dream in the Night Sky," is a very charming number with straightforward lyrics and a spectacular arrangement by the brass band.
I was watching the recording of the song, and it is a song with many repetitions of the same melody, so you have to change the way you sing the song for each scene.
So you have to change the way you sing in each scene to keep the flow of the song.
I was impressed by her precise pitch and rhythm, and when she performed "Beyonce", I could see the penlights in the audience were lit up with stars.
When you perform "Beyonce", the penlights of the audience look like stars, and it is a song that moves me while I sing it.
I felt that I would like to perform it again with even more feeling.

It's time to say goodbye to the up-dated paper brought to you by Saya Eguchi and Minami Okamura!
I watched a lot of videos this time, but I was most impressed by the recording of Tsubaki Factory's song "Shichibunsaki no Tsugi" (Continuation of the Seven Minutes Blossom).
I haven't heard this song live yet.

I haven't heard this song live yet, but as Saya-chan said earlier, the delicate pitch and the rhythm seem to be unexpectedly detailed and difficult, so I'd like to see how it changes in a live performance.
I, Eguchi, was impressed by the making of Akari Takeuchi's music video for the song "I have to go.
I was really moved when I saw it at the Yokohama Arena concert, but the music video gave me a different, bright and positive impression, and I want to see more of it.
UpCami takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the UpFront Group.
Please subscribe to our channel to get a glimpse of what you don't normally see.
This time, Upkami's partner is Sayu Eguchi of Beyond Subway,
and Minami Okamura of Beyond Amagamigawaumi.
